intro: Velaea serrata, commonly known as the serrated velvetleaf, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Velaea serrata is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its distinctive foliage.
